review.title: “A good company overall.”
review.pros: Pros – There is a great company culture and great health benefits. Stores are always closed on Sundays. There is no cap on commissions, the more you sell the better your check will be! Good incentives and promotions.
review.cons: Cons – The commission structure changes often, making it hard to know what you need to sell to make more money. Blackout dates during the holidays make it hard to use your vacation days. The job can be very repetitive- informing new customers of the same things over and over again.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “It was okay...”
review.pros: Pros – Good people to work with. Everybody gets along (almost). Very solid company with plenty of regional and national long-term growth potential. Very good benefits.
review.cons: Cons – Top management and owners are very obstinate in how they view employee compensations. You can't have a meaningful discussion about this because they will end the conversation. I'm glad this is a company that excels in the area of integrity in many areas. We need more companies like this. However, integrity falls apart when it comes to pay. After all, we live in a world where the object is to screw one another. Even from Christian pastors.The human resources manual states that C Spire Wireless does not discriminate on the basis of union affiliation. But, what would happen if everybody joined a union? They would get fired. This is doublespeak-integrity at its finest.I know so many people who used to work for C Spire Wireless (and some who still do) who constantly complain about the pay. I pray that one day these managers will see the light, and be transformed. I have confidence that one day these things will change for the better...You will be micromanaged, which bothers some people and is not such a big deal to others. You will be underpaid. Expect to hear ridiculous comments from upper management about how everybody in a department should be fired. It is laughable when they say these things, then they realize they are wrong.If you have good ideas to improve operations, management will often not care and this is missed growth potential, both for the company and the employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ask yourself if what you are paying employees is right in the sight of God rather than pat yourself on the back because the pay is "competitive". Do the right thing and don't be so selfish about paying employees what they should be making. Find ways employees can receive substantial increases in pay by making big contributions to the organization. Most people receive low salaries, but the top 50 people receive very high salaries. Please be more open to bringing your salaries more in line with those of employees to send the message that you are not so far above them...

review.title: “Downhill fast”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefitsGuaranteed 40 hours a week
review.cons: Cons – Management tends to be way too familiar with employees. A few managers know where the line should be and act accordingly while the rest of them flirt way too much with that line. The morale gets lower every year due to unreasonable goals and policies issued by those in corporate who are just looking at the numbers but are out of touch with the customer. They put way too much faith in surveys and mystery shops, which are important but should not be the entire view of the employee that corporate gets. There is no reason anyone should be as stressed out as their employees are 24/7 (which could explain the frat styled partying that takes place behind closed doors between some in management and employees).....
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The good old boy system needs to die in this company.... Also, check up on your regional managers to ensure they aren't just goofing around and actually doing something....
